WHAT IS A FRUIT
category.template: A fruit is the mature ovary of a flowering plant, typically containing seeds.

category.pattern: CAN FRUITS BE SEEDLESS
category.template: Yes, some fruits, such as bananas and seedless grapes, are naturally seedless or have been bred to be seedless.

category.pattern: WHAT IS THE LARGEST FRUIT
category.template: The jackfruit is considered the largest fruit in the world.

category.pattern: WHAT IS THE SMALLEST FRUIT
category.template: One of the smallest fruits is the watermeal - a tiny aquatic plant fruit - although some berries are similarly diminutive.

category.pattern: WHAT IS THE SWEETEST FRUIT
category.template: Many would say mangoes or dates are among the sweetest, though it often depends on the variety.

category.pattern: GIVE ME A RANDOM FACT ABOUT FRUIT

random.li: Did you know there are over 2,000 varieties of apples grown worldwide?
Fruits come in an incredible range of colours, shapes and flavours - nature’s very own palette!
The banana is technically a berry, while the strawberry is not.
Citrus fruits were once so rare in Europe that they symbolised wealth.
The durian is known as the "king of fruits" in Southeast Asia because of its distinctive aroma and taste.

category.pattern: HOW MANY TYPES OF FRUIT ARE THERE
category.template: There are thousands of fruit species around the world, each offering unique flavours and nutritional benefits.

category.pattern: WHAT IS AN EXAMPLE OF A CITRUS FRUIT
category.template: Oranges, lemons, limes and grapefruits are all examples of citrus fruits.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT IS KNOWN FOR ITS HIGH VITAMIN C CONTENT
category.template: Oranges are particularly renowned for their vitamin C content.

category.pattern: WHAT FRUIT IS USED TO MAKE WINE
category.template: Grapes are most commonly used to produce wine.

category.pattern: WHAT IS A TROPICAL FRUIT
category.template: Fruits such as pineapples, mangoes and papayas are classified as tropical fruits.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT HAS A HARD EXTERIOR AND A SOFT INTERIOR
category.template: Coconuts are well known for their hard outer shell and soft, edible interior.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT IS KNOWN FOR ITS FUZZY SKIN
category.template: The peach is celebrated for its soft, fuzzy skin.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT IS DRIED TO MAKE RAISINS
category.template: Grapes are dried to produce raisins.

category.pattern: WHAT FRUIT IS SYNONYMOUS WITH JAMAICA
category.template: Many associate the ackee fruit with Jamaica - it's even part of the national dish, ackee and saltfish!

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT HAS A SPIKY EXTERIOR
category.template: The durian is famous for its spiky outer shell.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT IS A STAPLE IN TROPICAL DIETS
category.template: Bananas are a dietary staple in many tropical regions.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT IS RICH IN POTASSIUM
category.template: Bananas are well known for their high potassium content.

category.pattern: WHAT IS THE MOST COMMON BERRY
category.template: The strawberry is one of the most popular berries worldwide.

category.pattern: WHAT ARE THE NUTRITIONAL BENEFITS OF FRUITS
category.template: Fruits are an excellent source of vitamins, minerals, fibre and antioxidants.

category.pattern: WHAT FRUIT IS USED TO MAKE GUACAMOLE
category.template: The avocado is the key fruit in making guacamole.

category.pattern: WHAT IS A STONE FRUIT
category.template: Stone fruits, like peaches and plums, have a hard pit or stone inside.

category.pattern: CAN FRUITS BE GROWN ORGANICALLY
category.template: Yes, many fruits are grown organically without synthetic pesticides or fertilisers.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT HAS THE HIGHEST WATER CONTENT
category.template: Watermelons are renowned for their high water content.

category.pattern: WHAT FRUIT IS POPULAR IN SMOOTHIES
category.template: Bananas, berries and mangoes are popular choices for smoothies.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT IS KNOWN FOR ITS TANGY TASTE
category.template: Lemons are well known for their tangy, sour flavour.

category.pattern: WHAT FRUIT IS OFTEN EATEN DRIED
category.template: Fruits such as dates and apricots are commonly enjoyed in dried form.

category.pattern: WHAT IS THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN A FRUIT AND A VEGETABLE
category.template: Botanically speaking, a fruit develops from a flower and contains seeds, whereas vegetables come from other parts of the plant.

category.pattern: ARE FRUITS CONSIDERED HEALTHY
category.template: Absolutely! Fruits are a vital part of a balanced and healthy diet.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUITS HAVE A NAME CHANGE WHEN DRIED
category.template: Several fruits undergo name changes when dried: - Green grapes become raisins. - Green seedless grapes become sultanas. - Small, dark red/black Corinth grapes become currants. - Plums become prunes. - Jalapeño peppers become chipotles.

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT IS THE LARGEST BERRY
category.template: Surprisingly, the watermelon is considered the largest berry!

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT HAS THE HIGHEST AMOUNT OF VITAMIN C
category.template: Despite oranges being popular, the Kakadu plum contains significantly more vitamin C!

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT HAS THE LOWEST GLYCEMIC INDEX
category.template: Cherries are celebrated for their low glycaemic index, making them a brilliant choice!

category.pattern: WHICH FRUIT IS HIGHEST IN FIBRE
category.template: Raspberries are exceptionally high in dietary fibre, a fantastic option for a fibre boost!

category.pattern: WHICH IS THE HOTTEST FRUIT
category.template: The chilli pepper, although not often recognised as a fruit, is renowned for its fiery heat!
